result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle M J Howlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact with victims or their families.

No contact with females under age 16.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:36 Defendant Kyle M J Howlett in court, in custody.  
Court orders that if defendant pays for UA and it is negative, he can have his Huber privileges reinstated.

2:01 Defendant Kyle M J Howlett in court, in custody.  
Wood County Jail is requesting that Huber privileges be revoked.
Court revokes Huber privileges for 30 days. If defendant pays for test and test is negative, Huber privileges will be reinstated. Can retest every two weeks until negative.
cover letter from Attorney Thuecks with letter of support for defendant
2:37 Defendant Kyle M J Howlett in court with attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim makes statement.

10:08 Attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gary Kryshak appears on behalf of co-defendant, Ryan Rodeghier.
Attorney Kryshak joins in co-defendant's motion for severance and motion in limine.
Attorney Grode states he has no objection to motions in limine.
Court grants as motions in limine.
Attorney Grode states he has no objection to motion to sever cases 15CF298 & 15CF299. Rodeghier's case 15CF298 will be tried first.
Court grants motion to sever.
Attorney Thuecks has filed a motion for bill of particulars. She wishes State to be more specific as to violation date. Attorney Kryshak joins in that motion and both attorneys make statements.
Attorney Grode opposes motion and makes statement.
Court denies motion.
Attorney Kryshak makes motion to modify Ryan Rodeghier's bond so defendant can attend youth group at his church.
Court will not rule on motion at this time until more information is gathered.

Defendant Ryan T Rodeghier in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle M Howlett in court with Attorney Chelsie A Thuecks.  Defendant Anthony C Christmas in court with Attorney Emily Nolan Plutchak.  The state motions to dismiss case 15CF250, against Anthony Christmas.  Court grants the dismissal of case 15CF250 against Anthonly Christmas.  Atty. Kryshak and Atty. Thuecks wishes to waive preliminary hearing on each of their cases.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No contact with victim or minors. Supervised visits with anyone under age 18.
No contact with the victim, TMAF or any minor under the age of 18 with the exception of supervised visitation with females under 18 if a family member.
Defendant Kyle M J Howlett in court with attorney Chelsie A. Thuecks.  Defendant Kyle M J Howlett in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
